meanings.definition: To travel from place to place.
meanings.sent1: She itinerated across the country to visit her family.
meanings.sent2: The salesman itinerated to different cities to promote his products.
meanings.sent3: The cat itinerated around the house, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts itinerated through memories of past adventures.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly itinerated gracefully from flower to flower, seeking nectar.

meanings.sent1: We itinerated through the forest, enjoying the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The group itinerated together to reach the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The toy train itinerated around the track, carrying delighted children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind itinerated to distant lands as she read the travel book.
meanings.sent5: The river itinerated steadily towards the sea, carrying boats along its path.

meanings.definition: To move or travel along a route.
meanings.sent1: The bus itinerated along the city streets, picking up passengers.
meanings.sent2: The hiker itinerated up the mountain trail, enjoying the scenic views.
meanings.sent3: The ants itinerated in a straight line, following their pheromone trail.
meanings.sent4: His gaze itinerated along the horizon, searching for any signs of land.
meanings.sent5: The car itinerated smoothly on the highway, heading towards the next town.
